snippet: At its policy-making meeting, the Federal Reserve said that it would pare its purchases of Treasury and mortgage-backed securities by another $10 billion, to $45 billion a month beginning this month.
abstract: Federal Reserve continues to retreat from its stimulus campaign; says it is looking past economic slowdown during unusually cold winter because growth is already rebounding; announces it will pare its purchases of Treasury and mortgage-backed securities by another $10 billion, to $45 billion a month beginning in May.
lead_paragraph: At its policy-making meeting, the Federal Reserve said that it would pare its purchases of Treasury and mortgage-backed securities by another $10 billion, to $45 billion a month beginning this month.

headline.main: Forecasting a Speedup in Growth, the Fed Again Cuts Bond Purchases
headline.print_headline: Forecasting a Speedup in Growth, the Fed Again Cuts Bond Purchases
